pullRequest.title: OC-537 MQTT protocol adapter
pullRequest.bodyText: Protocol adapter implementing the MQTT protocol using HiveMQ.

commit.message: OC-537 Bug fixes
OC-537 Fixes based on code review comments
OC-537 Switch to response flow

nodes.bodyText: Complete the task associated to this TODO comment.

commit.message: OC-537 Fixes based on code review

nodes.bodyText: Why is // XXX added here?
Consider renaming handleGetDataRequest to handleGetDataResponse.

The use of "both" suggests there should be 2 things?
Did you mean both a .war file and a docker image? Or could "both" be dropped here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,10 @@ Maven build:
 ```
 mvn clean install
 ```
+The build generates both .war file which can be deployed in Tomcat.

commit.message: OC-537 Fixes based on code review
OC-513 ~ Spring 5, Hibernate 5 and other version updates. JUnit 5 does not work without major changes, unit tests are commented for now.
OC-513 ~ Updates framework and library versions.
OC-513 ~ Removes commented code.
OC-513 ~ Sets 'schema_version' as Flyway table name.
OC-513 ~ Removes final from entity methods to resolve Hibernate warning.

OC-513 ~ Reverts --tags not @NightlyBuildOnly to --tags
~@NightlyBuildOnly.

Somehow the test-jar-with-dependecies can not be started when using
'not' instead of '~'.
OC-513 ~ Resolves Cucumber warings regarding deprecated "--tags ~@Tags".
OC-513 ~ Attempts to fix osgp-protocol-adapter-iec61850 startup problem.
OC-513 ~ Attempts to fix single quotes around 'not @NightlyBuildOnly'.
OC-513 ~ Uses 4 threads for the Maven build.
OC-513 ~ Removes git submodule update stage from PR pipeline script.
OC-513 ~ Attempts to fix single quotes around 'not @NightlyBuildOnly'.

nodes.bodyText: These 2 loggers for org.springframework.ws.server.MessageTracing and org.springframework.ws.client.MessageTracing have been used during development, I assume. Either remove then or adjust the logging level to WARN.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<configuration>
+
+  <!--
+    <appender name="DB" class="ch.qos.logback.classic.db.DBAppender">
+      <connectionSource class="ch.qos.logback.core.db.DriverManagerConnectionSource">
+        <driverClass>org.postgresql.Driver</driverClass>
+        <url>jdbc:postgresql://localhost/osgp_logging</url>
+        <user>osp_admin</user>
+        <password>1234</password>
+      </connectionSource>
+    </appender>
+  -->
+
+  <appender name="CONSOLE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
+    <encoder>
+      <pattern>%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS}] [${HOSTNAME}] [%thread] %level %logger{36}@%method:%line - %msg%n</pattern>
+    </encoder>
+  </appender>
+
+  <appender name="FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.RollingFileAppender">
+    <file>/var/log/osp/logs/osgp-adapter-protocol-mqtt.log</file>
+    <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeAndTimeBasedRollingPolicy">
+      <fileNamePattern>/var/log/osp/logs/osgp-adapter-protocol-mqtt.log.%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.%i.log</fileNamePattern>
+      <maxFileSize>100MB</maxFileSize>
+      <maxHistory>10</maxHistory>
+      <totalSizeCap>20GB</totalSizeCap>
+    </rollingPolicy>
+    <encoder>
+      <pattern>%d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS}] [${HOSTNAME}] [%thread] %level %logger{36}@%method:%line - %msg%n</pattern>
+    </encoder>
+  </appender>
+
+  <logger name="org.springframework.ws.server.MessageTracing" level="TRACE" additivity="false">
+    <appender-ref ref="CONSOLE"/>
+  </logger>
+
+  <logger name="org.springframework.ws.client.MessageTracing" level="TRACE" additivity="false">
+    <appender-ref ref="CONSOLE"/>
+  </logger>

nodes.bodyText:
Please clean up this property file. I assume these keys are not in use by the MQTT implementation.
Same for the properties below.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@
+#Database Configuration
+db.username.mqtt=osp_admin
+db.password.mqtt=1234
+
+#PostgreSQL
+db.driver=org.postgresql.Driver
+db.protocol=jdbc:postgresql://
+
+db.host.mqtt=localhost
+db.port.mqtt=5432
+db.name.mqtt=osgp_adapter_protocol_mqtt
+
+db.min_pool_size=1
+db.max_pool_size=5
+db.auto_commit=false
+db.idle_timeout=120000
+
+#Hibernate Configuration
+hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect
+hibernate.format_sql=true
+hibernate.physical_naming_strategy=org.opensmartgridplatform.shared.application.config.HibernateNamingStrategy
+hibernate.show_sql=false
+
+#Flyway configuration
+flyway.initial.version=20200127155743442
+flyway.initial.description=Initial version PostgreSQL
+flyway.init.on.migrate=true
+
+#EntityManager
+#Declares the base package of the entity classes
+entitymanager.packages.to.scan=org.opensmartgridplatform.adapter.protocol.mqtt.domain.entities
+
+#Paging
+paging.maximum.pagesize=30
+paging.default.pagesize=15
+
+# MQTT
+mqtt.broker.defaultPort=8883
+mqtt.broker.defaultTopics=+/measurement,+/congestion
+mqtt.broker.defaultQos=AT_LEAST_ONCE
+
+# =========================================================
+# MESSAGING CONFIG
+# =========================================================
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+# jms.default
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+#jms.default.broker.url=failover:(ssl://localhost:61617)
+jms.default.broker.url=failover:(tcp://localhost:61616)
+jms.default.connection.queue.prefetch=1
+
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+# jms.mqtt.requests
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+jms.mqtt.requests.queue=protocol-mqtt.1_0.osgp-core.1_0.requests
+jms.mqtt.requests.initial.redelivery.delay=300000
+jms.mqtt.requests.maximum.redelivery.delay=900000
+jms.mqtt.requests.redelivery.delay=300000
+
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+# jms.mqtt.responses
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+jms.mqtt.responses.queue=osgp-core.1_0.protocol-mqtt.1_0.responses
+jms.mqtt.responses.initial.redelivery.delay=300000
+jms.mqtt.responses.maximum.redelivery.delay=900000
+jms.mqtt.responses.redelivery.delay=300000
+
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+# jms.mqtt.log.item.requests
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+jms.mqtt.log.item.requests.queue=osgp.logging.protocol
+
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+# jms.osgp.requests
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+jms.osgp.requests.queue=osgp-core.1_0.protocol-mqtt.1_0.requests
+
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+# jms.osgp.responses
+#----------------------------------------------------------
+jms.osgp.responses.queue=protocol-mqtt.1_0.osgp-core.1_0.responses
+
+# =========================================================
+# Recover key settings
+# =========================================================
+executor.scheduled.poolsize=5
+key.recovery.delay=240000
+
+# =========================================================
+# Core retry settings
+#
+# Please note retries are scheduled as tasks and executed
+# by a ThreadPoolTaskScheduler. The effective minimum retry 
+# delay is therefore the interval of the scheduler.
+# =========================================================
+schedule.retry.mqtt.delay=30000
+schedule.retry.mqtt.retries=2
+
+schedule.retry.mqtt.backoff.multiplier=2
+schedule.retry.mqtt.backoff.exponential=true
+
+# device keys security
+encryption.key.path=/etc/osp/smartmetering/keys/platform/secret.aes
+
+encryption.rsa.private.key.path=/etc/osp/smartmetering/keys/platform/mqtt_device_keys_private
+encryption.rsa.public.key.path=/etc/osp/smartmetering/keys/platform/mqtt_device_keys_public

nodes.bodyText: Why is this class needed? Couldn't you use the default handling in the ProtocolResponseMessageListener without introducing a new class?
